FuncDef:
The queue cos-value command sets the scheduling parameters for a flow queue in a 4-CoS flow queue profile, including the scheduling mode, shaping rate, buffer size, and discard policy.
The undo queue cos-value command restores the default configuration.
By default, the configurations in a flow queue profile in 4-CoS mode are listed in Table 1 in Usage Scenarios.
CLIs: queue <cos-value> { { pq | wfq weight <weight-value> | lpq } | { shaping { <shaping-value> | shaping-percentage <shaping-percentage-value> } [ pbs <pbs-value> ] } | { flow-wred <wred-name> } } *
undo queue <cos-value> [ pq | wfq | lpq | shaping | flow-wred ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a service class.
The value can be:
cos0cos1cos2cos3

Sets the scheduling mode to PQ.
-

Sets the scheduling mode to WFQ.
-

Specifies a weight.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 100.

Sets the scheduling mode to LPQ.
-

Specifies a shaping rate.
The value is an integer ranging from 8 to 4294967294, in kbit/s.

Specifies the percentage of the shaping rate, that is, the proportion of the traffic-shaping bandwidth to the interface bandwidth.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 100, in percentage.

Specifies the volume of the allowed peak traffic on an interface after traffic shaping is configured on the interface. The value is equal to the PBS.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4194304, in bytes.

Specifies the name of a WRED object used by a flow queue.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: [*HUAWEI-flow-queue-template-test-4cos-mode] queue cos1 wfq weight 50 shaping 1000 flow-wred test
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set the scheduling parameters of a 4-CoS flow queue in a flow queue profile, run the queue command. The parameters include the scheduling mode (PQ/WFQ/LPQ), shaping value, buffer size (PBS), and discard policy (WRED). For example, to allocate a high priority to voice services and ensure low delay, configure PQ for voice services and set a proper flow-WRED profile.
Table 1 Default FQ Profile Configuration in 4-CoS ModeFlow Queue

Tail drop





Prerequisites
A 4-CoS flow queue profile has been created using the flow-queue 4cos-mode command.
The required WRED profile has been created.
Configuration Impact
Queue scheduling of services is affected.
Precautions
Configuring different WRED profiles for flow queues of different service types is recommended.
Parameters in this command do not need to be configured in a specific order. You can configure the parameters individually or collectively.
